chapters.title: The Survivor of Hathsin
chapters.summary: A thieving crew watches the nobility and plans a heist in the ash-covered city of Luthadel.

Kelsier.background: A legendary thief known as the Survivor of Hathsin, the only person to escape the Lord Ruler's most brutal prison.
Kelsier.arc: Returns to Luthadel with a grand plan to overthrow the immortal emperor who has ruled for a thousand years.

Dockson.background: Kelsier's longtime friend and the crew's organizer, skilled at managing the practical details of their operations.
Dockson.arc: Reunites with Kelsier and begins planning what seems to be their most ambitious job yet.

chapters.title: A Proposal
chapters.summary: Vin survives on the streets using her Luck while her thieving crew plans their next scheme.

Vin.background: A 16-year-old street thief with an unusual ability she calls 'Luck' that helps her influence people.
Vin.arc: Struggles to survive in her abusive thieving crew while hiding the full extent of her mysterious abilities.

Camon.background: The cruel leader of Vin's thieving crew who regularly beats his members and takes unnecessary risks.
Camon.arc: Plans a dangerous scam against an obligator, showing his greed and disregard for his crew's safety.

Theron.background: Camon's second-in-command who treats the crew members slightly better than Camon does.
Theron.arc: Helps plan the crew's scam while showing subtle signs of dissatisfaction with Camon's leadership.

Kelsier.background: A legendary thief known as the Survivor of Hathsin, the only person to escape the Lord Ruler's most brutal prison.
Kelsier.arc: Continues recruiting for his master plan, showing interest in crews with unusual members.

Dockson.background: Kelsier's longtime friend and the crew's organizer, skilled at managing the practical details of their operations.
Dockson.arc: Assists Kelsier in evaluating potential recruits for their unprecedented heist.

chapters.title: Rebels
chapters.summary: Kelsier saves Vin from her crew and reveals the truth about her abilities as Allomancy.

Kelsier.background: A legendary thief known as the Survivor of Hathsin, the only person to escape the Lord Ruler's most brutal prison.
Kelsier.arc: Reveals himself as a Mistborn and saves Vin from the obligators, recognizing her as one of his kind.

Vin.background: A 16-year-old street thief who just discovered her 'Luck' is actually a rare magical ability called Allomancy.
Vin.arc: Learns she is a Mistborn with the ability to ingest and burn metals for magical powers, opening up an entirely new world.

Dockson.background: Kelsier's longtime friend and the crew's organizer, skilled at managing the practical details of their operations.
Dockson.arc: Helps explain the basics of their operation to Vin and shows his role as the practical planner of the group.

chapters.title: The Good Thief
chapters.summary: Vin begins her Allomantic training and meets the rest of Kelsier's thieving crew.

Vin.background: A 16-year-old Mistborn discovering her abilities to ingest and burn metals for magical powers.
Vin.arc: Begins intensive Allomantic training while struggling to trust her new crew after years of abuse and betrayal.

Kelsier.background: A legendary thief and Mistborn who escaped the Lord Ruler's most brutal prison.
Kelsier.arc: Takes on the role of Vin's mentor, teaching her Allomancy while revealing glimpses of his larger plan.

Breeze.background: A Soother who can manipulate emotions using Allomancy, with a taste for fine wine and comfortable living.
Breeze.arc: Joins Kelsier's crew as their emotional manipulator, showing both his skills and his pompous personality.

Ham.background: A Thug who can burn pewter for enhanced strength and endurance, known for his philosophical debates.
Ham.arc: Serves as the crew's muscle while constantly engaging others in theoretical discussions about morality and society.

Clubs.background: A Smoker who can hide Allomantic activity, running a carpentry shop as a front for the crew's operations.
Clubs.arc: Provides a safe house for the crew while maintaining his gruff, pessimistic demeanor.

Spook.background: Clubs's nephew, a Tineye who can enhance his senses by burning tin, speaking in Eastern street slang.
Spook.arc: Acts as the crew's scout and spy while trying to prove himself to the more experienced members.

Sazed.background: A Terris Keeper who stores knowledge in metalminds and serves as a steward despite his people's oppression.
Sazed.arc: Agrees to help train Vin in court etiquette while sharing his vast knowledge of religions and history.

Dockson.background: Kelsier's longtime friend and the crew's organizer, the only non-Allomancer in the core group.
Dockson.arc: Manages the crew's finances and logistics while showing fatherly concern for Vin's well-being.

chapters.title: Believers in a Forgotten Tomb
chapters.summary: Kelsier reveals the crew's true goal: to steal the Lord Ruler's atium and overthrow the Final Empire.

Kelsier.background: A legendary thief and Mistborn who escaped the Lord Ruler's most brutal prison.
Kelsier.arc: Reveals his audacious plan to overthrow the immortal Lord Ruler and end the Final Empire's thousand-year reign.

Marsh.background: Kelsier's older brother and a former seeker for the rebellion, known for his stern demeanor and dedication.
Marsh.arc: Arrives to confront Kelsier about his reckless plans, revealing the complex relationship between the brothers.

Vin.background: A 16-year-old Mistborn discovering her abilities to ingest and burn metals for magical powers.
Vin.arc: Learns about the crew's true revolutionary goals while continuing to develop her Allomantic abilities.

Breeze.background: A Soother who can manipulate emotions using Allomancy, with a taste for fine wine and comfortable living.
Breeze.arc: Expresses skepticism about the plan but agrees to participate, using his abilities to help recruit noble house allies.

Ham.background: A Thug who can burn pewter for enhanced strength and endurance, known for his philosophical debates.
Ham.arc: Philosophizes about the morality of their plan while preparing to train a rebel army.

Dockson.background: Kelsier's longtime friend and the crew's organizer, the only non-Allomancer in the core group.
Dockson.arc: Works on the massive logistics required for their plan, showing his crucial role in making the impossible possible.

Clubs.background: A Smoker who can hide Allomantic activity, running a carpentry shop as a front for the crew's operations.
Clubs.arc: Maintains his skepticism about their chances while agreeing to provide safe houses for the operation.

Spook.background: Clubs's nephew, a Tineye who can enhance his senses by burning tin, speaking in Eastern street slang.
Spook.arc: Eagerly embraces his role in the grand plan, excited to be part of something historically significant.

Sazed.background: A Terris Keeper who stores knowledge in metalminds and serves as a steward despite his people's oppression.
Sazed.arc: Continues teaching Vin while subtly revealing his own interests in seeing the Lord Ruler's reign end.

chapters.title: The Plan
chapters.summary: The crew discusses the details of their heist while Vin learns about noble society.

Lord Renoux.background: An elderly nobleman who is actually a kandra impostor hired by Kelsier to provide a noble identity.
Lord Renoux.arc: Establishes a noble house in Fellise to give Vin a cover identity for infiltrating high society.

Vin.background: A young Mistborn learning to navigate both her powers and noble society.
Vin.arc: Prepares for her role as Valette Renoux while training intensively in both Allomancy and etiquette.

Sazed.background: A Terris Keeper with vast knowledge stored in his metalminds.
Sazed.arc: Intensifies Vin's education in noble customs, teaching her everything from dancing to dinner conversation.

Kelsier.background: The mastermind behind the plot to overthrow the Lord Ruler.
Kelsier.arc: Coordinates multiple aspects of the heist while pushing Vin to embrace her full potential as a Mistborn.

chapters.title: In My Younger and More Vulnerable Years
chapters.summary: Vin attends her first noble ball as Valette Renoux, entering the world of noble politics.

Vin.background: A young Mistborn posing as Valette Renoux, a minor noblewoman from the countryside.
Vin.arc: Successfully debuts at a noble ball, navigating the complex social dynamics while gathering intelligence.

Elend Venture.background: The heir to House Venture who spends balls reading books instead of dancing, considered odd by noble standards.
Elend Venture.arc: Meets 'Valette' at the ball and engages her in philosophical conversation, showing interest in her different perspectives.

Sazed.background: A Terris Keeper serving as Vin's steward and mentor.
Sazed.arc: Accompanies Vin to the ball, providing subtle guidance and support during her first major social test.

Kelsier.background: The legendary thief orchestrating the downfall of the Final Empire.
Kelsier.arc: Monitors Vin's progress while advancing other aspects of their complex plan against the Lord Ruler.

chapters.title: The Depths of Sorrow
chapters.summary: Kelsier takes Vin on a nighttime Allomantic training session across the rooftops of Luthadel.

Vin.background: A young Mistborn developing her abilities while maintaining her noble cover identity.
Vin.arc: Experiences the true freedom of Allomancy during an exhilarating nighttime training session across Luthadel's rooftops.

Kelsier.background: A master Mistborn known for his incredible skill and daring stunts.
Kelsier.arc: Teaches Vin advanced Allomantic techniques while sharing his philosophy about what it means to be Mistborn.

Elend Venture.background: The philosophical heir to House Venture who questions the Final Empire's social structure.
Elend Venture.arc: Continues to occupy Vin's thoughts as she finds herself drawn to his unconventional ideas and genuine kindness.

chapters.title: A Mistborn's Fury
chapters.summary: The crew's plans advance as tensions rise between the noble houses and skaa rebellion grows.

Kelsier.background: The Survivor of Hathsin leading a revolution against the immortal emperor.
Kelsier.arc: Escalates his campaign against the nobility while spreading his reputation among the skaa as a symbol of hope.

Vin.background: A young Mistborn balancing her roles as thief, spy, and noblewoman.
Vin.arc: Deepens her infiltration of noble society while struggling with her growing feelings for Elend Venture.

Marsh.background: Kelsier's serious older brother attempting to infiltrate the Steel Inquisitors.
Marsh.arc: Makes progress in his dangerous mission to join the Inquisitors, despite the extreme risks involved.

Breeze.background: A master Soother manipulating emotions to serve the crew's goals.
Breeze.arc: Successfully manipulates key nobles to increase tensions between houses, setting up future conflicts.

Ham.background: The crew's philosopher-warrior training the skaa rebellion.
Ham.arc: Reports progress in building the rebel army while continuing his endless philosophical debates.

chapters.title: Squads and Dances
chapters.summary: Vin continues attending balls while the crew's various schemes progress toward their ultimate goal.

Shan Elariel.background: Elend's former betrothed and a powerful noblewoman who secretly possesses Allomantic abilities.
Shan Elariel.arc: Takes notice of Valette Renoux and begins viewing her as a rival for Elend's attention.

Vin.background: A Mistborn spy becoming increasingly comfortable in her dual life.
Vin.arc: Navigates the growing complexity of noble politics while developing genuine feelings for Elend despite herself.

Elend Venture.background: The idealistic nobleman who dreams of a better society.
Elend Venture.arc: Shows increasing interest in Valette while sharing his dangerous ideas about political reform.

Kelsier.background: The mastermind pushing forward with his revolutionary plan.
Kelsier.arc: Warns Vin about getting too attached to Elend while continuing to orchestrate chaos among the nobility.
